Manager Response: Dear Sammymadison,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am truly sorry that you were not accommodated in a newly remodeled room. As a Diamond Member, you have earned the upgrades and appreciation and quite frankly, that didn't happen. I do hope we can welcome you back again soon to experience the true experience that Hilton has to offer.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I know me leaving my wedding ring on the table in my room was my fault. But I really expected the cleaning ladies to turn it in to house keeping. I called the hotel as soon as I noticed I had left it. I was told I would receive a call back. I never did so I called back. Was told again I would receive a call back. That was a week ago and I have not had a call. So make sure you leave nothing behind because you will not get it back. The two rooms across from me had young collage students who were smoking pot and the smell was awful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, nice rooms, very quiet
Summary: This hotel is directly across from the John Wayne airport--you can walk to the airport! But it was quiet and the lobby and bar area were quiet and nice for drinks and appetizers.  The rooms were well appointed and access to freeways, UCI, etc. was simple.
Manager Response: Dear Kesslane,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am thrilled that you enjoyed the hotel and the surrounding areas. We look forward to having you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Good welcome, friendly staff, clean environment, bar could be improved but generally a good & well run hotel. Currently renovations are in progress but doesn't seem to detract from the usual pleasant ambiance.
Manager Response: Dear Ian C,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am delighted that you enjoyed your time at the hotel. I am happy to announce that the room renovations have been completed.  We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location and value for Money.
Summary: Good hotel with great location if you flying in our out of SNA orange county airport. shuttle has timings so be careful. food in the restaurant was ok. Wi-Fi in corner rooms is really bad. they did offer to change my room but I had settled it and did not wish to change my room. overall a quiet hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stay at Hiltons quite a bit, especially Airport Hiltons. They get great locations and do them well. Irvine is an exemplar.  They have a good shuttle so you should strategize if and when you want to add a $20/day parking tab. Same thing can be said for the $20 breakfast, which is very nice, but there are less expensive options.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service from the initial shuttle bus pickup to the shuttle bus drop off in the AM.   Friendly staff, clean rooms, good food.   Hotel is next to the airport, SNA, so you do get to hear planes taking off and landing but it's not terrible, after all, what did you expect next to the airport.   For a hotel of this size the fitness center is way too small. I have seen Hampton Inn's with larger fitness centers and they have half the rooms. Equipment was good, just not enough space and enough of it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the perfect hotel for stay near John Wayne airport. Easy walk across the street. Spotless, comfortable rooms. Continental breakfast breakfast items tasty homemade muffins. We were greeted by Matthew who made us feel right at home. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised at the Hilton. I expected an average value for this room rate but instead was in a well-maintained property with a very large pool, nice restaurant/lounge area, The room on the executive floor was a nice size with a comfortable bed. I was in a room that faced the airport but the windows were insulated enough that engine noise never bothered me. They do charge for parking. Not much in the immediate area to do or eat if you want to leave the premises. Really only interacted with the front desk personnel but they were nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My three-day stay was great. Staff was very kind and courteous. Room was clean and away from any noisy areas, as requested. My work location was only 2 miles away so I didn't rent a car; the shuttle bus service was quite appreciated. Would like to come again the next time I'm in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic service, easy location, little remote.
Summary: I've stayed at the Irvine Hilton several times now on work and fun trips but my most  Arrived hours early, dead tired from an early flight and the staff got me into my room well before the standard time no fuss, no fee.   The breakfast buffet will run you $20 a person (or get a rate with it included if you can find a good promotion) but is definitely well done and beats most of the surrounding area hotels options by a long shot.  The gym is one of the more impressive facilities I've seen in a hotel property with a good selection of cardio and weight options plus included towels, headphones and other details you'd expect from this level hotel.  Wifi coverage is decent though not all that fast. Pool, hot tub in the courtyard and a lot of open space to wander around plus a nice
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pricing problem on hotel's internet site! Website of Hilton changes pricing on a daily basis - which is crazy!  Desk help would not honor the lower price just one day later!  There was a difference of almost $100 from one day to another!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Decided to stay an extra night we enjoyed it so much. Nice room and efficient staff, good breakfast and easy car parking. Easy drive to Corona Del Mar Beach which is fantastic. Plenty of dinning options nearby and the hotel bar is fine. The friendly staff made our stay a pleasure and we will definitely use this property again while transiting John Wayne.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I decided in the last minute to get away and stay in a hotel for the New Year weekend. We called Hilton Hotel Anaheim, California and they reserved us a great and spacey room on the 10th floor. Due to the ongoing construction, there was no room service available but the front desk staffs recommended great restaurants within five minutes drive from the hotel. Thank you to all the staffs at Hilton Anaheim for making our little getaway enjoyable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a pleasant experience! Cordial desk service who showed particular patience with an elderly lady.  Nice newly updated room!   What was particularly outstanding was the food ordered from the room service menu!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Props to Betty for serving me some great breakfast buffet (all you can eat) with Orange Juice and 2 Coffee pots. The food preparation/presentation was 5 star hotel conference catering experience. Fresh Fluffy eggs, tasty potato tots, various bread/bagel type choices (toaster) and jelly bowl with butter. Then I topped it off by watching the College Football games and Soccer on the sports TVS. Plenty of plugs  (like 20) under the bar area for laptops. Great experiences in the Internet Bar, Lobby Bar Lounge and restaurant areas.  1. Plenty of Self Parking but, expensive. Expected at this airport area hotel. 2. Next to great restaurants and large up scale mall is across highway 405. 3. The Internet Bar, Lobby Bar Lounge (with sports TVs) and restaurant areas are all Boss.  The room
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here the nights of Christmas Eve and Day. Room was newly remodeled. Arrived to a slightly bad smell (new carpet perhaps), that dissipated with the balcony window open for a few hours. Roomy and nice king sized bed with plush sheets and comforter.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hilton Irvine for a couple days at Christmas with our pooch. The front desk folks, in addition to welcoming us cordially and efficiently, went out of their way to greet Bear, our 10-year-old Basset Hound.  And every time we'd go out past the desk, Bear would get a shout- out.  The hotel itself is fine.  Our room was spotless and spacious and pretty quiet.  Great shower head.  We had one minor glitch getting on the net but that was resolved quickly.  Good choice for dogs.  Bear was a happy camper.
Manager Response: none

Summary: On a recent stop-over on our way to Mexico, my wife and I stayed at the Orange County Airport Hilton.  It is located across the street from the airport, and although the hotel does offer shuttle service we chose to take the short walk to the property.  The hotel offered nice comfortable rooms, and good food service, at a reasonable price.  It was a great way to kick off our vacation.  We will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The best thing I liked about this hotel was the iron in the room
Summary: I thought Hilton was higher up the chain of their brands, but this wasn't it. Next time I'd rather stay at the Doubletree Club just down the road.  Lower rate, a bigger bed and cookies!  Rooms here are bland, have double-sized beds and at least in the room I stayed in, a non-working TV.  The only plus about this property is that it's directly across the street from the airport.  Far better options in the immediate area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location across from the airport
Summary: Not as noisy as most airport hotels. You can't beat the convenience of being across the street from SNA. The hotel itself was nice; not luxurious or extravagant. Just a good business hotel. Parking was expensive. Restaurant: my server was very attentive. However, 45 minutes after ordering a flatbread he told me it was being prepared and apologized (my dinner was comped).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel.....just need to catch the little things
Summary: Hotel was beautiful, service was great, room was good.  Housekeeping needs to pay attention to the details in cleaning the bathrooms.  And, they need to leave more than just 2 sets of towels.  I would recommend staying here, but make sure you ask for more towels if you have 2 or more people in your room.  And you might need to ask EVERY day for the extra towels.  My request only lasted 1 day, then they went back to just 2 towels.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pool and jacuzzi were being "refurbished", per the front desk receptionist.  I was told to use the Atrium pool, which was even worse, as they did not have the pool heated, and The Hilton had no control over the Atrium pool.  It was a terrible experience overall. Parking was $20 and they said it was the cheapest around.  Also, they did not say you could get free Wi-fi if you signed up for the free Hilton membership online.  Meaning to say, they just wanted you to purchase their wi-fi for 6+ bucks!  I can't remember experiencing this bad of a customer service in my life.  Never going back to Hilton Irvine again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Cool hotel, business oriented and located super close to SNA airport.  Good food, nice rooms, good service. What more is there? Oh the price, very reasonable.  The marketplace in side is open 24 hrs too. Feels a little "boutique-ish" outside grounds are nice as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was very clean and comfortable.  The staff is always friendly and they were very accommodating to my service dogs.    My only recommendation is to be more reasonable with their prices at the bar/restaurant. For two top shelf drinks, I paid $38!  For a basic continental style buffet with eggs and bacon, I paid $19 per person.  Plus they hit you with parking fees.
Manager Response: none

Summary: OK for a Hilton property.  Expected a little more but better than most others.  Service was A+ but breakfast was overpriced and parking was $20 per night.  Great location and staff was awesome.  Will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older property that is going through some renovation, however, it falls short and still very much dated.  The chlorine in the hot tub was so strong, it ruined my swimsuit.  The AC was noisy an constantly kicked on which kept us up most the night.  Staff was indignant and nonexistent.  Breakfast buffet was a joke and cost $19 for stuff one gets at the Hampton Inn for free.  Construction starts early, so get to bed early.  They charge for everything.  Only way to get a luggage cart is to request a bellman who comes with the cart but also expects a large tip.  We left and went to Marriott Costa Mesa which was a great improvement.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had read some reviews that indicated this hotel was in need of updating.  Those reviews are outdated as the hotel appears to be freshly remodeled and very clean.  Our stay over Thanksgiving was great and I plan to return to the hotel for my next and most likely future overnight visit to the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were scheduled for a single night stay, leaving for the airport the next morning.  Immediately prior to departing for the airport my wife experienced a severe asthma attack, leaving her gasping for air and nearly passed out on the floor of the room.  A call to the front desk initiated a 911 call, paramedic transport to the hospital, and a four day stay at Hoag Irvine.  The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful and supportive.  They accommodated my extended stay, checked with me on her condition daily, offered assistance of any kind I needed, kept my rate at the lower weekend check-in rate, did more than I would have expected from a hotel.  Aside from the emergency, the stay was excellent.  Clean, well provisioned rooms, excellent bar area, friendly and helpful staff, I
Manager Response: none

Summary: There was something very special and congenial about the staff here. I wish I had taken down everyone's names, but it was uniformly delightful. People seemed genuine, and happy. It was infectious, and it made our stay memorable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Comfortable rooms, nice lobby, convenient to John Wayne Airport.  Had water main breakage on departure day, and water was shut down to repair.  Was handled efficiently so we could wash up and depart on time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fantastic! Loved it here, it smelled great upon arrival, staff was very friendly and helpful. Very convenient for fliers, easy to park, easy to get to! Great overall experience and would for sure stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a fine hotel to stay at. However, it may need some updating to the decor (carpeting) on the 5th floor. There were several spots where it was bumpy and could have used a stretch to even it out. Not a deal breaker, but noticeable. The breakfast was good and the service was excellent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are currently some renovations underway at the property, but the stay and customer service was still good. Of particular note was the nice view out my window of palm trees and other structured and well maintained things in Irvine. The airport shuts down over night so don't worry about the noise. Of note was the breakfast, which I found to be delicious. The coast is right down the road, so I think this is a good location. Kind of ridiculous they charge for parking even though there's tons of space around there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife's Mother and her birthday celebration: we needed a place to hold the party. there were 2 family birthdays 8 -9 guests and the hotel went to great lengths to support the memorable occasion. Thank you Hilton
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is located across the street from John Wayne Airport & is currently being renovated. Our room was surprisingly quiet. A little noise during the day but very quiet at night. Room and bathroom were very clean and bed was comfortable. I have stayed at this hotel twice and was very satisfied each time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay at an incredible amount of Hilton properties every year and this one just hit the bottom of my list.  I am a "Diamond" member, which, I don't think actually means anything anymore.  I seek out Hilton hotels because they make my life easier on the road.  Now I will be avoiding actual "Hilton" hotels. Paying $20 a day for parking, $15+ for breakfast, a luggage cart that I ask to use but "only a bellhop can use" blah blah. I'm here as a working professional.  I get paid to load other people's bags and I'm not about to pay someone to haul mine around. If I want to lug my own bags on your luggage cart then you should probably let me. You know who lets me use their luggage carts? Hampton, Embassy Suites, Hilton garden, Homewood suites, I digress... Enough about dragging my
Manager Response: none

Summary: Service....close to the airport....rooms...close to the airport...did i mention it is close to the airport....Rooms--very close to the airport....right across from the airport....airport is close...dining...It is really, really, really,really close/very close to the airport....This hotel is horrible!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Right across the street from John Wayne (Orange County Airport)....will cost a little more because it is so close to the airport.....great shuttle and can even walk....a remodel going on....pool, hot tub, and workout room...would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is beginning a badly needed remodel and there was a note in the room stating that construction would not begin until 9:00 AM M-F and 10:00 AM S-S, HOWEVER, at 7:20 AM my room starts shaking as some moron is using a rotary hammer on the slab.  I was on 9th floor and my business partner was on the 10th and it woke him as well.  A rotary hammer on a slab will shake the entire floor.  I was there on business taking a client out to dinner and drinks so I did not get to sleep until almost 3:00 AM so I got about four hours sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for one night on our way from Disneyland as it was close to the airport.  The shuttle in the morning was a bonus.  The room was clean.  Nothing overly special especially since we have to convert our dollar and the room in turn cost around $200 Can.  Having said that, there are no complaints.  The staff were friendly and accommodating, I would just like to spend less.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed at the Irvine Hilton three times and have been very satisfied with the hotel. It's right across from the John Wayne Airport, but it's very quiet and doesn't feel like an "airport" hotel. The rooms are nice, the staff is helpful and it's close to many restaurants and major shopping areas. I'll definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Traveled to California to play in a local tournament. The coach did a great job of picking the hotel. The hotel went above and beyond to accommodate my last minute request for an additional room. The lobby was beautiful and everyone went out of their way to provide a high-end experience for me and my family. I'll be back in a few weeks to do it all over again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent a night here on business. Nothing to write home about. Small but comfortable rooms. You absolutely need a car to get around, as the hotel is located very close to the John Wayne airport, but besides that - nothing much in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Arrived late and was greeted by a wonderful front desk staff, and clean well appointed lobby and a small, but lively bar area.  The room was clean, quiet and had a balcony that overlooked the courtyard and pool. The bed and pillows put me to sleep instantly. Very comfortable and cozy.  Being right across the street from the John Wayne Airport the convenience is second to none, and shockingly the rooms extremely quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found a good deal on this hotel and decided to stay here because we saw some good reviews. We were not disappointed! It's a modern hotel with a swanky-looking lobby. The rooms are nicely appointed, and the guest staff is very attentive and friendly.  Here are a few highlights/tips that others may not have mentioned: 1. The pool area is very nice for sunbathing. There are 6 free cabanas there that are ideal for families and/or those who don't want to be in the sun. Most places charge for these but here they were complimentary. 2. The Marketplace has some good food at amazing prices. Frankly, we were blown away by how economically-priced things were. Not only were prices not hyper-inflated as in most hotels, but some things were less expensive than at a local food joint. We
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pretty good hotel.  I'll stay there again.  The staff is pretty awesome.  Kat is a real standout for excellence in hospitality.  5 stars out of 5.  The only suggestion I would offer for improvement is to get a guest washer and dryer on each floor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The check-in experience was not good.  Seems like the lady checking the guest that day is in a bad mood.  The hotel does have executive rooms but no lounge.  The air-condition in the room is old and quite noisy. The duvet in the room has a weird smell on them.   I am a Hilton Honors Gold but was not offered free breakfast.  Not sure if they recognize HH status in this location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was placed in a handicap room without being informed.  Room had a bad odor - source was somewhere near the bed and nightstand.  When I phoned the front desk, was informed that they were sold-out.  Booked a 4-nt stay through American Express - couldn't make it past one night.  Amex phoned hotel and spoke to FD Supervisor (Miguel) who refused to provide a refund for other days - not even partial.  My fault for trusting Hilton - never again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Quality is excellent staff & accommodations. However, the room rate (don't forget you have $25 parking fee on top) is a bit over others in the area.  In fact we would have been charged $10 & $20 more each additional night - not a weekend stay. We planned on staying in the area for several more days & ended up relocation our hotel for a better rate, no parking fees, bar bill was not $10 a beer.

Summary: This Hilton Hotel provided great service during my 2 day stay in the Irvine California area.  It is a great location across from Santa Ana airport. The hotel staff as very helpful and assisted during my stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: The staff were friendly, the room was nice and it was a good value overall. The elevators were always quick to arrive and we didn't have any issues with the stay other than a parking situation which we thought was pretty ridiculous.  Very cool wall A/C unit, easy-to-find ice machine and although we could hear planes taking off, it wasn't that bad and we actually go used to it.  Cons: Some small nitpicks--no movies available to purchase, although they had a few HBO channels.  Popcorn ceilings, and rooms in need of some updating (which I hear they're doing), although the bathrooms were nice with plenty of counter space.  The one irritating issue we had is when we tried to leave the hotel for the day on Saturday.  Some conference had just let out, so there was a line of cars

Summary: Ok, the place is close to the airport, across the street close.  But my sleep was not disturb by it. If you have a rental car there is a gas station 2 doors down from the hotel.   Parking is not cheap, but hotels in San Francisco charge 40 - 50 dollars a night.   Breakfast buffet is ok , staff were very friendly and even gave me an iced tea to go. Beds are ok, room was clean but the hotel  is in the process of a remodel.   Was on the executive floor but did not notice any difference.   Asked housekeeping to make up my room early and I did not have to wait.  By the time I arrived back to my room from breakfast it was done.

Summary Heading: Only average and sometimes sub par
Summary: This Hilton is old and going under redesign. It is located very close to the airport and our office but it needs a lot of updating. The pool area is nice. The air conditioning was loud, the workout room is very small.

Summary: If you have low expectations, then this place will be just fine.  I had a room that emitted high pitched noise from the bathroom.  Woke me up at 6am and I called the front desk and they sent a building engineer up to the room.  He heard the noise and immediately knew what it was and showed me how to stop the noise (by turning on the shower and turning it off to relief the water pressure in the pipes).  3 am next night, it happens again and front desk finally offers to move me to another room.  Also, for my troubles, they offered a bottle of water and a voucher for appetizers.  They tried I guess? But to me, that is the definition of doing the least they could have done.  Bottle of water and appetizer for keeping me awake 2 nights when I had early work days? Wow, Thank you!

He gave us a voucher for a free drink and a voucher for an appetizer and drink for my grandson.  The young gentleman Eric at the valet parking saved us money by informing us we could go on line to get discounted long term parking.  He actually went into the hotel and did the transaction for us on the hotel computer.  We were so impressed.  Oh, and our room was clean and so comfortable!  Loved it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel staff was extremely helpful.  Great bar area and bartenders were awesome!  Loved the pool, but a bit noisy, if you are looking to relax, this might not be the best place for the pool.  Only set back was airport noise - request an East facing room away from the airport - might help.  Other than that, the hotel was very clean, updated amenities, and would be great for business, couples, family, friends or solo.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Its not up to the Hilton standards.  I have stayed at the Double Tree down the road and got better service.  The parking facilities are expensive and cramped and clearly not enough.  Even being a Honors member was not enough to include breakfast in the room charge... The Double Tree gives you that.  Next time I will opt for that or even Homewood Suites
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Add $20 to the rate for parking!
Summary: This is a solid property. Great customer service, clean well-appointed rooms, good restaurant and bar (open late). $20 for guests to park isn't a great value. Another reviewer recommended dropping your rental off at the airport before checking in. Great idea.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Staff was very friendly and helpful
Summary: Booked six rooms for extended family for an event on the UC Irvine campus... Front desk staff including Miguel were excellent in helping us coordinate our many rooms, and Jerry and Beatriz in the dining area were very attentive in taking care of our large group at the breakfast buffet (with multiple comings and goings with our extended family over 2-3 hours)... All of our contacts with the staff were great!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: David at the front desk checked us in and was very professional and positive.  The bell staff was attentive and the valets were on the ball.  Overall, this place is excellent due to the service, comfort and cleanliness of the rooms, and the proximity to John Wayne airport (across the street).    Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the area this place makes for a good home base if you want to go to the beach (Balboa/Newport piers, HB or Laguna), shopping at South Coast Plaza or Irvine Spectrum, and Disneyland.  easier: get a late check out, drop rental car at airport, take hotel shuttle back then take shuttle w/ family and luggage to the airport when you check out.
Manager Response: Jack R,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed the hotel amenities, proximity to surrounding areas and more importantly our team members. I will be sure and share your comments with the team.   We hope to have you back as our guest in the near future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I drove down from LA and the GPS took me to the door where the door staff were good and efficient. Reception staff - particularly Miguel - are friendly and efficient. And knowledgeable. The rooms are a good size but overdue for a serious makeover - the artist boards for which are on display in the lobby. Airport noise isn't really an issue despite close proximity. And for the shopaholic its 10 minutes to Fashion Island. Breakfast selection is adequate if not spectacular. The staff on duty are attentive and adaptable.
Manager Response: Peterroy2014,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am glad you enjoyed the hotel amenities and the proximity to local shops. The hotel will be under renovation (guestrooms, meeting space and exterior) in late 2015.  We hope to welcome you back again soon!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: This is a great hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are fairly up to date, clean and quite. The proximity to the John Wayne/Orange Co. airport makes this hotel very convenient for travelers using that airport.
Manager Response: airickl,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and more importantly for your kind words regarding our team members. I am glad you enjoyed the hotel and the convenience to the airport.  We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Has a great restaurant for the business traveler. Restaurant Staff very friendly. Room was quiet, well maintained and clean buy a little pricey. Hotels looks a little old from the outside it needs a little work.
Manager Response: Javier,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I appreciate your kind words about our staff. I will be sure to relay the comments to the team. We do agree with your comments regarding the exterior and the building. In fact, the hotel will be under renovation (including the exterior) at the end of this year.  We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Upon arrival we were told we had to pay $20 per day on parking.  We never accepted this on the terms and conditions for Hotwire but we were already there and had to pay for it.  Employees were not very helpful nor friendly, seemed to be distant and too busy to care for guests. The rooms were veryclean, although small for a 4 star and the bathroom was extremely small.  The wifi was $10 per device, that was outrageous!!!  We were on the 3rd floor close to the entrance and it was extremely noisy at night.  Clean hotel, good location but crappy customer service and bad attitudes towards guests.
Manager Response: Lizrome23,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am truly disappointed to hear about your experiences here at the hotel. We do work hard to ensure our amenities and the prices for the amenities are listed on all websites. I apologize for any miscommunication on behalf of the team here at the hotel. I will most definitely speak to the team members involved to make sure they understand that a high level of service is administered at all times.  I do hope we can welcome you back in the future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for one night on business. Very close to the airport and some dining options. Room was comfortable but near an elevator and full hotel so a bit noisy. Staff was very friendly. Good water pressure for the shower. Overall no complaints.
Manager Response: Ashlee,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us. It does at times get noisy when there is high occupancy, but I am glad to hear our staff was friendly.   We hope to welcome you back as our guest in the near future!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: If flying out of SNA (Orange County) It is a great place to stay. The shuttle to the airport works well. It provides goos value and is modern and up to date. I use it several times a year and have also found the restaurant to be well run and food is good.
Manager Response: Raymond,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stays with us. I always appreciate hearing that our guests have enjoyed the convenience and amenities in the hotel. We are in the process of updating our menu choices in all outlets, so I hope you can join us again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Had a business meeting in Irvine.  Flew into LAX and drove over to Irvine. Check-in was efficient and service was good.  Internet was included.  They appear to be getting ready to upgrade the rooms although my room was pleasant.  Guests use their room card for parking exit.  No executive club but no complaints.  I would stay here again if I had business in the area.
Manager Response: South_Pacific_Seas,  Thank you for the review of your recent stay with us!! I am happy to hear that you found our hotel convenient for your travels. As you saw, we are going to upgrade many areas of the hotel at the end of 2015. I do hope you will come back and see us again when you are in the area.  Thanks again.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Me and family have a very nice experience at this hotel. From de concierge, the shuttle driver, bell girl, up to the the restaurant with Beatriz y Daniel Martínez, Jorge Mateo, Rubén and the other Jorge, all them make feel like been at home (also better).   We stay from April 30 up to may 5 at room 428. Is the second time we been there, and our next trip we are going to return here.  Congratulations Hilton for have people like this!!!  Victor M. González M.
Manager Response: Victor,  Thank you very much for the kind words about your stay with us and more importantly pointing out a few of our outstanding team members!! I will be sure and share your comments with the team.  We hope to welcome you back as our guest again soon!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Well after a long month of moving it was nice to stay in a place that is close to that feeling of home..... we had a relaxing weekend with our family. The grounds are nice and very easy for pets as we have 2 small dogs.
Manager Response: David,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am glad the hotel was a nice change of pace from your move and you had a relaxing time with your family.  I hope to welcome you back as our guest in the near future!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Lost our poster, poor customer service
Summary: Traveled to present research at a conference. Shipped our poster to present to the hotel, they lost it. Never apologized, blamed us for "shipping too soon" (2 weeks), never found the poster and haven't been contacted since. Never experienced such bad attitudes from staff at any Hilton before, ever.
Manager Response: Caitlin,  I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry for the disappointing service that you received. I will make sure to address these issues with our staff and reiterate the communication that is necessary to fulfill our guest needs. Exceptional guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback helps us to improve.   Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I am a regular business traveler to the Hilton Irvine, so I write this updated review with a LOT of experience visiting this hotel.  Here's what I know:  1) Outstanding lobby reception, no matter who is staffing the check-in desk.  The evening crew (the one I deal with the most) is particularly good.  (Kudos to the manager, Eldred Powers.  He always seems to have very positive interactions with guests and staff.) 2) The grounds and facilities are In perfect shape.  Anyone staying here can find plenty to do, including using the large year-round outdoor pool or the fitness center.  (I swim and use the hot tub each morning of my stay and am normally the only one there.)  Great for families who might be visiting Disneyland or business travelers looking for a workout. The outdoor
Manager Response: Mike,  WOW, Thank you for your kind words and your loyalty to the hotel!! I will be sure and pass on this review to the team to review. We are lucky to have dedicated team members in all areas of the hotel.  We look forward to having you back as our guest in the near future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: nice hotel super close to airport.  so close that it is hard to believe they only run a shuttle every half an hour.  seems like it should just make a circle constantly.  other than that, friendly desk staff and comfortable room.
Manager Response: Morgan,  Thank you for the review of your recent stay. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the room and more importantly the service in the hotel. We are directly across the street from the airport which is very convenient. We do offer shuttle service within a 3 mile radius of the hotel to shops and restaurants, which does hinder us from running our shuttle constantly to the airport.   Again thank you for staying with us and we hope you will be back again soon!!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't beat this hotel for service and amenities!
Summary: Stayed here for a business trip and actually slept!.  Beds were perfect (I don't usually sleep when staying in hotels so this was a plus).  Staff could not have been friendlier or professional.  They always had at least 2-3 people at the desk so you didn't have to wait to be served.  I managed to get a blister and they were so sweet about giving me bandaids.  They have a beautiful courtyard to enjoy your breakfast and we even sighted a hummingbird in it.  I only had breakfast in the restaurant which was a nice buffet of eggs, potatoes, pancakes, fruits and cereal.  Wait staff was attentive even though it was a buffet.  My room was in the 2nd building and was larger then most hotel rooms with a place to work and a small fridge.  I used the fitness center in my building and it was
Manager Response: Jennifer,  Thank you for the kind words about the hotel and the staff. I am happy that you enjoyed your time with us!! I will be sure to pass on your comments to the entire team. I am also glad you enjoyed the patio area. This area will also be included in the upcoming renovations and will get even better.  We hope to welcome you back soon!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik

Summary Heading: Great location...close to everything in Orange County
Summary: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  Rooms were very nice and clean.  Beds were super comfortable.  Spent a week at this hotel and found the location very convenient to my work assignment location, great restaurants and the beach!   Only real challenge I had was that WIFI was a bit weak up on the 8th floor. When I checked out, my internet charges were waived and this was a nice savings. Miguel S. served our team at the front desk and was super friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Bonnie,  Thank you for the review of your recent stay with us. I am glad you enjoyed your time and that the service of our team members was friendly and helpful!! I am sorry to hear about the weak Wi-Fi on the 8th floor, but we are looking to upgrade the bandwidth and distribution during our upcoming renovations.  Thanks again and I look forward to having you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, all services excellent
Summary: Staff was helpful & polite. Food was pretty good, parking was easy. Very convenient to stay by the airport. Room was immaculate. Snack area is convenient. Free coffee for early risers - great. Would choose this hotel again for future travel in Irvine.
Manager Response: Megan,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am so happy that you enjoyed your time with us!! I will definitely pass on your kind words to the team.  We hope to welcome you back as our guest in the near future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: the shuttle was not offered as a mode of transportation other than to a shopping center so I spent 400.00 on a car that I did not need.   My final bill was not emailed to me with the adjustments that were promised.    The parking is pay by the day and this was not conveyed to me upfront.   The amenities are ok but too pricey for me.  If I did not have to be here for business I would not have stayed.
Manager Response: Angelia,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am sorry to hear that there was a lack of communication regarding amenities and services at the hotel. We do strive to ensure each guest understands the fees and services offered. Our shuttle does only go within a 3 mile radius of the hotel to ensure proper airport pick-up and drop-off times. Again, I apologize and hope we can welcome you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: My husband and I were visiting family in both Laguna Niguel and La Habra. This location seemed to be the best in between area, and the price was better than most of the hotels in the area. The Hilton is very conveniently located near the John Wayne Airport, so I knew it was perfect. The rooms were spacious, nice mattress, and the AC worked great. The staff was friendly and got us checked in very quickly. We will be staying here again when we come back out to visit.
Manager Response: Ariel W,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time with us while visiting family. I will definitely share your experience and comments with the staff.  We look forward to having you as our guest again in the future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Great Hotel Great people Every body was very nice and help my kids with all their needs also the rooms had a great view and where very clean The location of the hotel was perfect and help our family a lot and was a great vacation
Manager Response: Sergio E,  Thank you for the review of your recent stay with us. I am glad you enjoyed your vacation and that our staff was able to assist with your needs. Our staff will be delighted to hear your comments.  We hope to welcome you as our guest again in the near future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient, but tired, overpriced, and micromanaged.
Summary: Stayed here recently on a trip out west.  Had reservations for 1 night, got here a day early.  When we arrived, it took over half an hour to check in, because the front desk staff was one VERY busy person.  While we waited to check in, we got to watch a drunk assault a customer-?!?  Initial room was tired, and the only thing louder than the HVAC was the airport.  Next morning, they cheerfully moved us to an alternative room.. much better.  Breakfast was very good.  Property is old, and has been updated.. but still shows it's age.  Staff was making efforts, but... not a best representation of the Hilton name.
Manager Response: Anonymous45066,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am disappointed to hear that it took quite a while to administer your check-in. It is always our goal to expedite the arrival of our guests. I apologize that there was an unruly guest in the bar area and will definitely follow up with our food and beverage team as well as security to ensure these types of guests are handled appropriately. Be advised that our property will undergo additional room renovations in late December and will have a new/fresh look once again.  Thanks again and we look forward to having you as our guest again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: In the area to view a college campus. I didn't realize when I booked the hotel, it was a room with two double beds..for 4 people. Two people in a double bed..not very cozy. We are usually in hotels that have two queen beds.   The breakfast buffet is not worth the price. It doesn't offer anything above bacon, eggs, cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit. Pricey for standard foods.   Have to pay for self parking.  Clean. Convenient location.
Manager Response: Khnmlh,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I do hope that the trip to view a local college was a success. I am sorry for any miscommunication regarding our bed sizes. We do have king and double beds. We will be implementing a new menu for each meal period and hope to add new choices with each.  I do hope we can have you back as our guest again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I was very pleased with this hotel.  The only problem I encountered was the fact that I could not connect to the internet.  During this trip I stayed at 2 Hiltons, this location and the other in Cupertino where internet was far better and "free" to guests.  At this location there is a charge.
Manager Response: Benton,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am glad to hear that you were pleased overall with your stay. I am sorry that you had challenges with the internet and we will definitely be looking into the system to ensure it is working properly. We are also in the process of getting an upgrade with our entire network that would allow us to offer basic free services and increase bandwidth and speed.  We hope to have you back as our guest again soon!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Very quiet. Expected some noise being so close to the airport - but I never heard a plane or road noise. Comfortable beds with an abundance of pillow. I wished they had free WiFi, though.  The hotel is with walking distance to some nice restaurants.
Manager Response: John,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your time and the quietness. I too am disappointed that the towels were replaced as it is a Hilton Standard and will definitely follow up with our Housekeeping department to ensure compliance.  Thanks again and we look forward to having you as our guest again soon!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Efficient and Easy for SNA Travelers
Summary: I stayed here for work and it could not have been easier.  The hotel is right across the street from the airport (tip: exit from the airport parking garage door to get to MacArthur Blvd) so no need to deal with a shuttle, cab, or rental car.  The restaurant/bar was excellent, beers are cold and the food is more sophisticated than you might expect - I had a Tuscan tomato soup and Thai chicken lettuce wraps, and I was really happy that I decided to eat back at the hotel after a long day rather than stop for fast food.  Bed and bathroom were clean, wifi worked fine (it's not free, though), and really that's all you need.  A great value.
Manager Response: suffolkblueline,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I appreciate the kind words about the location, services and our Food and Beverage options. I will be sure to share your review with the team. We will be instituting a new menu in the very near future, so I hope you will be back to try the new items.  Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Front Desk and Restaurant Personnel
Summary: This hotel's front desk and restaurant personnel are great. Needing to stay here often, I always receive friendly greeting and hear them doing the same for others. They seem to go out of there way to recognize regular guests. Hotel offers the best location adjacent to the John Wayne Orange County Airport.
Manager Response: Great2TravelCA,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your stay(s) with us. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our staff and recognize their willingness to serve. I will be sure to share your thoughts with the team!!.   I hope we can welcome you back as our guest again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: I switched hotels after one night
Summary: I stayed here for its proximity to the airport. I have decent status with HH and really find it a strange hotel for Hilton. Maybe they bought it recently? I see some response below that renovations are happening - couldn't be soon enough.   I don't really know what to put my finger on, it was just not a good experience. Certainly the airport noise was there, but it was more than that. The lobby bar looks like it was just cobbled together in an open area. There really are limited food options as others have pointed out.   Anyway - after a night I checked out and moved to Embassy North Airport - so much better. I will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Jon,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am truly sorry to have lost your business after one night. We do appreciate your Hilton Hhonors status and your loyalty to the Brand. You are correct that the hotel was purchased recently (Dec 2014) and have begun plans for a full renovation at the end of this year. We are also rolling out a new Food and beverage Concept soon that I feel is quite exciting There have been many changes recently with Leadership and vision for the hotel and I hope that we can welcome you back once the changes have been implemented.   Thanks again for your loyalty with Hilton!!  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: My  husband and I stayed here thinking we would get more sleep prior to an early morning departure from the airport across the street than at home about a 100 miles away.  Sadly, this was the worst night I have ever spent in a hotel.  That is saying a lot having spent 21 years in the military personally and traveled to over 20 different countries.  The AC unit was so loud, it even grumbled through ear plugs and then it would over heat- set it at 70 degrees and the outside temp was perhaps 72 at the time.  One lamp was missing a light bulb, all the fixtures, furnitue, and envirnmental controls were well worn and could use some maintenance. The floors could use a regular vaccuuming and the bathroom floor mopping. One positive - the bedding was clean.
Manager Response: Denise,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. On behalf of myself and the staff I want to apologize for the air conditioning unit not working properly in your room, along with the other issues encountered. I've worked with maintenance to fix them, however, I apologize that it wasn't resolved sooner. As well, I understand that you were not satisfied with the cleanliness of your guest room, and I am deeply disappointed by that. We will be under a full renovation late this year and hope to have these issues resolved permanently.  Thank you again, and I hope to have another chance to serve you in the future.   Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I am a Hilton Gold member and I stay at many Hiltons in the USA and abroad. I pre-checked into the Irvine Hilton using the iphone app. We arrived at the hotel and we were greeted by the curb attendant. He downloaded the luggage into the hotel carrier and I told the attendant I already checked-inn  using the iphone app and I was going to return the rental car.  I told the attendant to help may wife to get the keys to the room and take the luggage to our room 734.  A few minutes later while on my way to return the rental car, , I got a call from my wife that the desk person wanted to verify that I would allow her to get the keys.  Again, I asked the outdoor attendant to accompany my wife to get the keys to the room and carry the luggage.  Once I got back to the hotel, my wife was
Manager Response: Guillermo,  First and foremost I would like to apologize for the lack of service you and your wife experienced at the hotel. We do appreciate and value our Hilton HHonors members and you should have received the level of service you expected. I have personally shared your experience with the team and will continue to drive the importance of service throughout our hotel. I do hope that we can welcome you back as our guest again in the future.  Thanks again for your loyalty.  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I would like to express my dismay with a recent stay and the treatment I received at your hotel from Thursday, March 11, 2015 through Friday, March 12, 2015.  When I made my reservation to stay at your hotel on March 6, 2015, the total for my stay was $264.17 including taxes and service charges for the dates previously mentioned. I opted to get the executive suite due to the fact that I was there on Official State Business and agreed to the additional $12. 00 charge and the $18.00 parking fee.  This would make the total cost of my stay $294.17 for two days.  Upon checking into the hotel on Thursday,  after my credit card was swiped, I was informed that my stay was $318.53 which was different than what was quoted to me prior to my arrival.  At that moment I informed the employee
Manager Response: Tonita,  Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry for the disappointment with our policies. Your comments will be taken under consideration and the staff will be addressed as we continue to re-evaluate the needs of our guests continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.   Regards, Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: We came in late around 11pm, and left at 6am, so didn't have a chance to really see much of the hotel. But the end was comfortable, and the room was really clean.  I also really appreciated that they had liquid body soap. I'm not a fan of the at soaps, so that was a plus.
Manager Response: Kayla,  Thank you very much for the review of your recent stay. I am sorry you weren't able to experience many of the amenities we have to offer, but hope you can on your next stay with us.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: What can I say?  Gotta love the Hilton! - the room were the most clean rooms I've stayed in.  Not one hair in the tub, that's a first! - beds were beyond comfortable, I melted and slept better than ever - the water is soft and as crazy as it sounds, it was one of the best and most relaxing showers ever - the customer service was impeccable, especially the busy valets - the coffee was actually decent for a hotel, nice to wake up to  - the catering food was delicious, thankfully The common theme - love this hotel and will definitely stay again.  Thank you, Hilton, for making me feel at home!
Manager Response: tr21,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I truly appreciate the kind words and hope that we can be your hotel of choice when you are in the area.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: We were here for a conference in Anaheim. Hotel employees were very helpful from the people at the front desk to the people in their restaurant. They were all very accommodating from driving us to a local restaurant to remembering what we ordered for breakfast the day before.
Manager Response: Diane,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I appreciate the positive feedback of the staff and will be sure to share that with them. We hope to welcome you back with us the next time you are in the area.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: Good for business - limited food nearby
Summary: I have stayed in this hotel a few times for business.  Overall it has good accommodations and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  Here are a few specific things to be aware of: 1.  Rooms are in good condition except for electrical outlets on the lamp bases which frequently don't work.  Carry an extension cord.  I like a cool room for sleeping and the AC worked better than most hotels.    2.  The lower floor rooms (<6) near the entrance of the hotel can get some outside noise.  Try to choose floors 7-10 on the pool end for more quiet. 3.  There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance and some which deliver.  The hotel restaurant/room service has a reasonable menu and food quality is OK.  Generally if you want to dine somewhere beside the hotel you need to drive
Manager Response: Brian,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I have passed along your comments to our staff. The hotel will be under renovation in all guestrooms beginning in early December of this year. We have taken into account the lamps and outlets in each room as well as the air conditioning units. We are also rolling out a new menu very soon that I hope you will enjoy on your next visit.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Hilton to attend an event at the Marriott. We were flying out the next day so the proximity to the airport is great. There is a chevron station next door to fill up the rental car and the entrance to the airport is three minutes away.   The hotel is a typical clean and tidy hilton. Nice beds and amenities. There isn't much around so don't an in walking to many spots.   The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a large lobby and nice outdoor seating area to soak in the California rays.  Valet parking is 25$ per night.
Manager Response: Zkrscasa,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am glad to hear that you found our staff to be friendly and helpful. We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Ideally located hotel near the airport. Nice, clean rooms and nice lobby/bar space. The service was great, particularly Jerry G in the bar/dining area. Very customer focused and professional. I travel a lot and he is a stand out and great Hilton representative.
Manager Response: P B,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am very pleased to hear that you experienced the great customer service of Jerry while you were with us. I will definitely share your comments with him.  Thanks again and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: Utilized this location for a very high profile meeting for our company and this Hilton exceeded expectations and over delivered. Would highly recommend for any business need. Meeting room was well equipped. Also, stayed at the night and room was comfortable, and as always, up to a true Hilton standard.
Manager Response: Crystal,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay/meeting with us. I am very pleased to hear about your positive experience in all aspects and will be sure to share them with the team.  Thanks again and we look forward to having you as our guest in the near future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: They were at your becon call at all times.  Very kind and helpful and a place I will return to.  Clean rooms, fast service, and friendly staff.  I couldn't say anything more about how pleasant the stay was.
Manager Response: Angela,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I appreciate your positive comments about the staff and will be sure to share your sentiments with the team.  We look forward to having you as our guest again in the near future.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: This Hilton is one of the worst I have stayed at. I would have moved to another hotel but no rooms nearby. All of the rooms have sliding glass doors to an unusable balcony. This hotel is situated right across from the runway at John Wayne airport. Also the AC units vent directly outside so you have two big sources of noise into the room. Do hotel architects not stay at airport hotels?  The staff is excellent and will provide you with earplugs for no charge.  If you are a light sleeper skip this Hilton.  This Hilton has no concierge lounge for Gold or Diamond members, how cheap.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here on business. The hotel staff was wonderful and provided great business lunches in the conference room. This is an ideal hotel if you do not have a car. I had a two day business trip here and it was very close to the largest mall I've ever seen and many wonderful restaurants. I walked over to Di e end shop both nights. The hotel also had a restaurant and many things to do. The room was very large, clean and comfortable. An ideal location for business or pleasure. I took the hotel van to and from John Wayne airport. That service was fast and one of the more efficient ones that I've used. The room was very large and fairly inexpensive.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had one of our programs in this hotel. The ballroom was nice & staff were friendly. We had free Wi-Fi in the lobby, which was great. Food was okay & could be better. The room was nice & clean. Bar area is pretty cool. Regular Parking is very expensive but we got a discounted rate which is still too much!
Manager Response: Majid A,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I appreciate the kind words about our staff and accommodations. We are continuing to update our menu and food options so be sure to check back with us. We hope that we can welcome you back again soon.  Regards,  Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary Heading: lost stuff in the hotel room and bad service
Summary: I stayed in this hotel for 2 full weeks recently. In the 3rd day of my stay, I lost a t-shirt inside my own hotel room. I reported this to the front desk, somebody promised me to give me a feedback. After 2 days, no feedback received, I called the front desk again, talked to a manager, got a promise again. After another week, I went to the front desk, asked again, and the staff said he would write it down and ask for it. Until the day I left, I still haven't heard anything, so I asked the front desk again when I checked out. After I came back to my home country, I got an email from a manager of the hotel, saying they could not find my clothes.  It is not an expensive t-shirt. When I reported it missing for the first time, I thought if they could not find it, I would just forget
Manager Response: PoneL.  I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry for the disappointing service that you received; I will make sure to address these issues with our staff. Exceptional guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback helps us to improve. We hope you will stay with us again the next time you travel to the area.   Thank you, Rob Koscelnik General Manager

Summary: I am a frequent traveler and often stay at Hilton hotels for business. This one was a complete disappointment. Yes it's directly across the street from the airport, but with that comes noise and traffic. The air-conditioners in the rooms are very noisy. I also found the common areas somewhat dated and in need of an upgrade. The exercise room was quite nice, with with good amenities. Do not rely on the front desk staff for advice. They told me I should not go to the nearby South Coast Plaza because the parking was impossible. I went anyway and the parking lot  nearly empty with plenty of room. They also could not  recommend any local restaurants other than the hotel restaurant. This is pretty disappointing for a common business area where there are tons of restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful, convenient place to stay near Orange County Airport
Summary: The staff at this hotel are consistently fantastic!!  The Restaurant staff are polite, attentive and helpful (there are many - for years Rueben and Jerry have been awesome).  The front desk is equally so...Miguel, Dora and Ray are fabulous.  Every time I stay they look after me with a smile.  Miguel always sorts out my problems, sorting out any requests repeatedly...he should be called Magic Miguel!!  Thanks and see you again.  Tim M
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near the airport
Summary: Great hotel with a solid staff. If you need to be close to John Wayne airport this is as close as it gets (across the street). There are lots of good restaurants within walking distance. You are required to pay for internet $10 per day
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been staying at the Hilton for over 1 year, and I would appreciate if they would change the menu more often , it is always the same thing please make sure they review the menu .  As for the other services the concierge Shuttle  is very reliable , they are always available to server their customers.  Thank you
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay here on a regular basis.  The room is excellent.  The service by the staff is excellent.   Miguel and RaVonne are just super! The entire hotel, from top to bottom, seems to always be spotless. Best of all, it's right across the street from John Wayne Airport!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms in this hotel uses the older outside wall individual split system AC units so when they are on, they are quite noisy.  Many of the rooms also have an access door to the neighboring room which if you don't know your neighbors, they can be quite noisy as the sound proofing is not good.  Since this is right across from the airport, you will also hear some planes taking off.  Otherwise, this was a clean pleasant hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here about 6-8 times and the staff is always very pleasant.  The servers and bartenders good out of their way to get you what you need. Rooms are always clean along with the entire hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Started off BAD but ended up GREAT!
Summary: My wife and I had a last minute change of plans and were searching for a cheaper place to stay just for one night before we headed off the San Diego the next day. We found this Hilton to be the least expensive, booked our room and headed out there from Las Vegas. When we arrived at about midnight, we were just told when we arrived that there was also an $18 self parking charge. Strike 1! Well, we were tired from our trip and paid for it. The next morning, my wife's best friend arrived and she and my wife went downstairs for a bite to eat. They then waited 10 minutes and finally had to hail down a waiter to take their order and they could not even accommodate my wife's simple order and they brought her a full breakfast order. Strike 2! Finally, upon paying the bill, the waiter
Manager Response: none

Summary: Solid hotel with respect to cleanliness.  Room was quiet and well maintained.  Staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant.  Would definitely stay there again.  Proximity to the Orange Co. Airport (SNA) was also a major plus.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fees for parking, internet, breakfast, fridge, microwave not appreciated
Summary: Very good hotel if you get rid of the excessive add-on fees.  Fortunately, there was not a fee for breathing the air.  Service A+, very friendly.  Clean rooms, decent rates for room itself.  Guest services good.  We did not appreciated the extra fees: Parking $18/day, Fridge $10/day, Internet $10/day (just used Iphone hotspot), Breakfast $10/day.  If the extra fees are dropped, fine place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I worked with Dora to book this stay and she was the best hotel concierge I have ever had the pleasure to work with. She included a complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and sparkling wine during our stay. I was celebrating my boyfriend's 28th birthday and we were upgraded to the Executive Suite as well. Dora was so professional and kind during the entire process. I would recommend this hotel just because of her.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First off, this hotel is absolutely gorgeous!  Parking wasn't an issue and the reception desk was very cordial.  The room was spacious and and had a great view of the city.  One of only complaint is that the room did not have a mini fridge for us to store our leftovers.  However, maybe I should have read closely what the hotel room would provide.  Another complaint is that the closet door seemed jammed.  Not too sure if that was intentional or not, but I would've liked to place my dress shirt and jacket in there.  These are just minor things though;  Overall, my stay was great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here one night in December. The hotel is convenient to the airport with a free shuttle, but if you don't have a lot of luggage it isn't a far walk.   The room I had is in need of some maintenance. The sliding door to the small (unusable) balcony was impossible to use, and the shower drain was nasty. The bed itself was comfortable and clean, and the TV had many more channel selections than you typically find in a hotel which was a nice bonus.   The restaurant food was fine, but the servers seemed disinterested in their jobs.   Overall an average hotel, but not up to typical Hilton standards I'm accustomed to.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I typically try and stay at Hampton Inns or Hiltons because of their quality and value. This hotel is no exception except for the parking fees which are common for this area. For access to SNA you can't beat the location. I turned in my rental car the night before and walked across the street. So the location actually saved me money. Nice hotel with bar and small restaurant. Comfortable rooms. Price a little higher than others but again the location can't be beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff at this Hilton are extremely focused on serving the customer.  They are pleasant, professional, efficient, and very accommodating.  They provide a shuttle service to nearby places in addition to the Orange County airport.  You are suppose to make arrangements ahead of time, but the first day I did not realize this.  The Shuttle supervisor took me himself to the desired destination.    Everything else at this Hilton was also very well done.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The wifi not is a charge per day whereas in the past ( I checked my stay from August compared to this stay and it was free then.  Not a big deal but still, was free before for Hilton Honors members now free only to top tier.  Work paid for it but was a little annoying where everybody has complimentary wifi nowdays.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Catering to the expense acount crowd
Summary: this hotel was definitely up to the normal Hilton standard. Bed was very comfortable, room was clean and bathroom was normal. But you will pay through the nose for this. Breakfast was the biggest disappointment; nothing fancy, normal hotel breakfast but $19. I did not even spend that much at the Hilton in Singapore. Bottom line unless you are spending someone else's money, I would find another Hilton.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have never been to Irvine before and the staff was so helpful in pointing me in the right direction. With only one to to site see I can say the staff hit a home run. They were attentive since I first arrived. Always two to three folks in the lobby to answer questions and resolve any issues or concerns. Would highly recommend hotel, plus it's only minutes from the airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was okay at best.  The restaurant a nightmare. I would think that the management here needs some reviewing.  The Hilton chain is usually very dependable.  This was my worst experience in a long time. Maybe just a n odd one.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were there for business and had a great time.  Your facility had all the right amenities to help us relax during our downtime.  We also stayed an extra night so we would not have to hurry to the airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary: REALLY- over $200 per night... to me it reminded me of an upgraded RED ROOF INN... not very friendly service. Plus, as a loyal HILTON and always either GOLD or Diamond did not even get upgraded. NOT WORTH THE PRICE and certainly will be forced to look at other options next time in Costa Mesa!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm a Hilton Honors member, so I stayed at this property for 3 nights while vacationing with friends and family over the Thanksgiving holiday and to visit Disneyland. The hotel is about 20 minutes from Disneyland, which was a good choice on our part. The rooms are clean and the beds were super comfy!  Daniel and Eldred at the Front Desk were very friendly and helpful.The hotel restaurant is right off the lobby, which fills the area with tasty aromas during breakfast time!   The only downside is that you have to pay for parking. It's $18 per day. Outside of that, this was a great place to stay.   The hotel is near an IHOP, which is open 24 hours. This was awesome, especially after spending all day at the theme park.
Manager Response: Thank you for the terrific review!  Thank you for recognizing Eldred and Daniel. They are our dynamic duo and they will certainly appreciate your comments.  I'm glad that our hotel and location met your needs. We appreciate your continued loyalty to Hilton and can't wait to welcome you back.  Warm Regards,  Regina M. Stryker-Guthrie | General Manager Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport

Summary Heading: BRUTAL SERVICE - I WILL NEVER STAY WITH HILTON AGAIN
Summary: We reserved 2 rooms with a king bed in each room for a 1 week family almost 7 weeks before our arrival.  This would have been our third stay at the Hilton Irvine.  When we got there, we found out that the hotel overbooked and they didn't actually have any rooms available at all.  Then they somehow scrounged up two handicapped rooms for us, each with only a twin bed in it.  When I asked them if they had our reservations showing in their system, they said yes they did, but a reservation did not guarantee the room we reserved.  I couldn't believe what the manager had said to me...  A reservation only guaranteed a room, not the type or quality of room, nor the actual rate - this was HILTON POLICY!  We asked if we could go up and see the rooms and they allowed us to.  The room was
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review of your experience with our hotel earlier this year.  It is a great disappointment to me whenever we fail, but it is of particular concern to let down a valued guest who has been so loyal to our hotel.  .    I can appreciate how upsetting it must have been to arrive at our hotel and be told that we were not able to honor what you had reserved.  Please accept my deepest apologies.  Although we did not appropriately display it during your previous visit, I assure you that we value your business.  I hope that should your travels bring you back to Orange County, you will allow us to demonstrate the level of service you have come to expect from our hotel.  Sincerely,  Regina M. Stryker-Guthrie | General Manager Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport

Summary: I arrived at the hotel about 3 hours before check in time. The front desk clerk informed me that my room was not ready and did ask for them to put a rush on it. The front desk agent took my luggage and tagged it and gave me my claim check.I then proceeded to sit in the lobby at the hotel computer and within 5 min she informed me that my room was ready I was very impressed with how fast she was able to get me in my room. The valet staff was great very efficient and friendly and the room was great as well. The only downside Is I would expect an executive room to have a mini fridge but on the plus side they had a great terry cloth robe.The location is fantastic literally right across the street from the John Wayne Airport which was super convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide a review about your recent stay.  I am happy that our Front Desk team partnered with our Housekeeping team to get you a room quickly.  Thank you for your feedback on our Executive level rooms.  We do have refrigerators available upon request.  Please let the Front Desk know that you prefer a refrigerator and they will ensure the information is added to your profile.  Thank you for your business and we look forward to seeing you soon.  Warm Regards,  Regina M. Stryker-Guthrie | General Manager Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport

Summary: I have stayed at many nice resorts and Hotels over the years, this particular Hilton I would not recommend to anyone. The room had bugs in the bathroom, the beds were very uncomfortable, and the noise level made it hard to sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback on your recent stay with us.  I apologize for your experience and I must say I am bit surprised by it. We installed new Hilton Beds by Serta in all our guest rooms in July of this year and typically receive many positive comments.  I am sorry that it did not meet your expectations.  Pest activity in our rooms is incredibly rare as our rooms are routinely serviced by a pest management company.  We will certainly step up our efforts to ensure this is not repeated. I apologize.  Given our proximity to the airport, there can be intermittent noise but we do benefit greatly from John Wayne Airport's hours of operation and noise abatement procedures.  I apologize for our failure to provide an experience more typical of what you would expect from Hilton Hotels & Resorts.  Sincerely,  Regina M. Stryker-Guthrie | General Manager Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport

Summary: Stayed at this Hilton last month for two nights on business. Across the street from SNA airport but no airport noise. Clean rooms with coffee maker, safe, iron and balcony. I had a king room and was upgraded to Honors floor and received free internet and breakfast due to my hilton vip gold status. A very nice property that I would stay at again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Right Across the Street from John Wayne Orange County Airport
Summary: Very close to the OC Airport, that the Positive and the Negative about it.  Lots of meeting rooms and free airport  shuttle service.  Self parking at a lower cost than Valet parking.    Clean rooms and good hotel service.  Older property but well kept.  There is room service and on site casual dinning plus a full service bar. Of course the Hilton bed is always comfortable.  However this hotel has a weak shower flow.    I was on Executive Floor with a few more amenties but no refrigerator, a disappointment for me.  Limited snack store in hotel so get yours before going to this hotel.    Because jets are taking off across the street, very frequently, sometimes one after another, it's noisy up til about 10 PM.  Then it quiets down until 6:30 AM.  There are many good dinning options
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay with us.  We value your feedback as it is a great assistance to us. Thank you for the additional detail on the water flow issue.  Our Chief Engineer is investigating the matter to ensure it is not repeated.  We do have refrigerators available upon request.  The next time you stay with us, please let the Front Desk know and we will add the request to your profile.  Thank you for your business and we look forward to being of service to you again soon.  Sincerely,  Regina M. Stryker-Guthrie | General Manager Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport

Summary: I have frequented this hotel many times.   Their customer service gets better with each visit.
