No ice bucket in our room which we called to have replaced.  After 45 minutes we called again and they had forgotten, but then brought it up immediately.  Over all, a good deal for the money but I think I will spend a little more next time and stay else where.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this hilton weekend in mid January to visit nephew at UCI.  Got a terrific rate at priceline so not expecting much.  Hotel location is good.  Had a friend drive me around so glad that the $20 per night parking did not apply or would have greatly impacted my perception of any valie.   Had to wait in the lobby for one hour until just before 3pm.  Thought that was a bit odd as the hotel seemed empty but was advised no clean rooms ready.  Finally approached desk and was given two keys - would have been nice if someone had advised me when the room was ready as I was the only personin lobby area.  The condition of the rooms are adequate - not typical of the majority of hilton hotels but typical of an aging airport hotel.  Dirty glasses next to my hotel room door were an
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a few minutes shuttle from the airport and quite conveinent as the main shopping malls were 5 min away.  The staff were pleasant and the shuttle drivers would take you anywheres you asked when not making a airport run (within a 15mile radius). The buffet breakfast is really good and a great bargain for $15 extra a night.  Big selection of hot and cold with egg station. The only things that were a problem were the phoning for the shuttle bus at the airport.  The phone link did not work making it difficult to get the front desk.  And the other was that there was some noise being next to the elevator by hearing it go up and down at times.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for a couple of nights when I was back in Irvine for business. It is a solid hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable, my internet connection worked, there wasn't any noise (although I did specifically ask for a quiet room). The food in the lobby restaurant/bar was fine, but since I know the area, I did some grocery shopping and ate snacks and breakfast in my room.   This definitely seems to be a business hotel. It has a very convenient location for driving to a number of places (Costa Mesa, South Coast Plaza, Irvine, Newport Beach) because it is right by where the 55 and the 405 intersect. However, there's not much to walk to in the immediate vicinity, if that is what you are looking for.  Overall, reasonable and fine. I would stay here again, considering the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great - no hesitations staying here again!
Summary: This was a great Hotel for a brief business stay near the airport.  The service was excellent - esp. good at the front desk.  I was only there for a night, but they upgraded me, the room was lovely, for an airport hotel, the view was nice, too.  The room was lovely, clean, modern and stylish.  I would stay there again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you back with us.

Summary: I recently stayed at this property for one night for business. Raves include:  - the most comfy bed I've slept in in recent memory  - very attentive and curteous staff. One of our workshop attendees was having a birthday. The staff was nice enough to find a small candle ans some matches so we could present him with a "birthday" breakfast muffin.   - lovely bar/restaurant with very modern feel. They are located in the lobby, so it's very open and airy. Menus looked good, though we didn't specifically dine in the restaurant.  - Lots of comfy seating outside for enjoying a drink or soaking in the sun.  - Rooms are nicely appointed. Coffee maker, tv, sitting char and plenty of lighting options. Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries in the bathroom and big towels.  - airport is a stone's
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post your review and look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Booked Through Hotwire @ $65 + $10.26 in taxes and fees
Summary: Newly renovated and very comfortable. I'm not sure why Hotwire rates it at only a 3.5 Star, as it looks very 4 Star.  The facilities are nice as it's an older building and I'd guess the rooms are larger than if it were new construction.    The lobby and common areas are really spectacular for this type of airport Hotel (regardless of brand) The rooms are nice, comfortable and attractive.  The service was very average (maybe so-so) but hey...it's an airport hotel.  For anyone considering flying in and out of SNA (John Wayne/Orange County) WOW - It is so nice and so EASY.  The whole complex plus the whole area is so easy to use, and convenient...it's just off the I 405 and works for both LA and SD as long as you have a car.  Hotwire (maybe Priceline?) customers beware:  We were
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked thru Hotwire.com & got the room for 59.00 a night. Two night stay cost me 137.00 w/ tax. Got a double room for me, the wife & kids & was very pleased with the condition of the room, amenities & hotel location. Other reviewers complained about air traffic noise due to the proximity to the John Wayne airport but it was a non issue to me as I never heard any airplane noise. Internet service was 12.95 a day which I passed on & parking was a lil steep at 16 dollars a day. Hotel staff was friendly and attentive & Hotel was immaculate & shiny. I would definitely stay here again. Every member of my family was satisfied with the experience.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but the staff sucks! Charge me parking when I didn't even have one.
Summary: The hotel looks great. Everything is nice and clean. Only problem is the staff and "they charge parking fee of $16 per night to guests".  This is not acceptable in Orange County. They even put it on my bill without me knowing it. They did not bother to check to see if I park there or not. They charge the visitors that came to pick me up if they stay longer than 15 minutes.  Good thing I found out before making the payment. A few of the staff are rude. They don't take care of any concern you may have. Will not stay in this hotel again.

Summary: This place is very very nice and very very well kept up. the hotel is very clean and very up class. My only complaint was with one person. Funny thing is that this same person (who i think was a manager) i ran into in the elevator and i felt the need to tell him how impressed i was by this hotel.    The parking is pricey at $16 per day. Summary Heading: This place is even better now...the renovations seem to be competed
Summary: This hotel has always been a fantastic place, the staff is nice and pleasant and very accommodating and willing to help. The renovations turned this place into an incredibly beautiful hotel, with an open lobby, beautiful furniture and great looks. The bar and restaurant are in the lobby, and are just gorgeous. We loved the veiw into the outdoor patio and really loved the food. The guest rooms are some of the best in the area...comfortable, modern, and the beds are just incredible. If in the area, we strongly recommend this hotel!

Summary: Stayed at this property for a small conference.  In January 2008, renovations are underway that are signficant in the lobby areas.  The room was adequate and nicely furnished.  Wireless internet was available for a charge.  The bar had been turned into a bar/restaurant and was too small for the number of patrons.  Guests also needed to be careful of wet paint (signs) and an functioning elevator without a finished interior.  It is directly across the street from the John Wayne airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for a wedding.  They were doing a lot of construction, but the rooms were still clean and very updated.  People below talk about the rude staff, but we did not meet one staff member who was not over-the-top friendly - so it looks to be that they are working very hard on that.  I would definitely stay there again if we had another event in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is really really nice. New rooms really nice beds and all but everything else is horrible. The staff was very very rude except for the bar tender. They had the typical Orange County attitude problem! Which i still can't understand but anyway they had to have put me in the most noisy room and when i asked to change rooms i was told that the airport noise would cease after 10pm. Well tha's nice and dandy but when you are trying to relax at 8pm that doesn't help! I travel A LOT and trust me stay in a lot of airport hotels all over the world and none was as loud as this one!

Summary Heading: Irvine Hilton Is Still Old..And Needs A Better Staff!
Summary: Even though the rooms have reportedly been refurbished,..they need to 'refurbish' the staff! Only 1 valet parking attendant..with $18 a night..one should not have to wait for car delivery! A/C Unit is old..and  makes more noise than cool..window/sliding doors only open 3 inches..are they worried about anyone jumping out? Maids early AM are louds with loud walkie talkies....poor exeperience..I would choose the Costa Mesa Hilton anytime over this old hotel~

Summary: My wife found the Hilton on line. We stayed for one night and we were very pleased with the hotel.  Our flight arrived at Orange County Airport about 9:00 a.m. and we decided to see if we could check in early as we had plans for the entire day and we did not want to carry our luggage around in our rental car.  The hotel was able to accommodate us and we checked in at 10:00 a.m. The room was clean with a king-sized bed, flat screen display and the staff was extremely friendly.  The location was right across the street from the airport but it was not noisy at all.  Parking was $13 extra.  We would recommend the hotel again  There is an IHOP just up the street where we ate breakfast. I was disappointed that hooking into the internet was an extra charge. Later on this same trip we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Got this room on priceline. It is well located and clean. The rooms are very nice and typical of a suburban Hilton. the workout room is small but the equipment is good. I didnt try any food so cant comment on that. Overall it was a solidly good experience. For 70 dollars on pricelne it was great, but not worth the rack rates although they are high all over this area. I would put the hotel as solidly 3.5 stars.

Summary Heading: Would Love To Stay There Again!
Summary: This Hotel Was AMAZING! The staff was SO Nice! The Room was Decorated Very Nicely! The Bed Was SO Comfy! Everything Was SO Clean! The bath products they provide are awesome! This hotel is located in a nice, clean, safe area and isn't too far from Laguna and the Pacific Coast Hwy. The view from our window of city lights was really pretty! I Loved the Decor and all the granite furniture and granite sink top in the bathroom. This was a Really nice hotel! I would LOVE to stay there again! :) Oh and I stayed there for two nights... July 20-22. This hotel far surpassed my expectations and was far better then the Sheraton at Symphony Hall in San Diego (which I also stayed at for two days and was supposed to be a higher quality hotel). Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed three nights (July 19, 20, 21) and were very pleased. Our party consisted of 7 people using 4 rooms. Everyone enjoyed our accommodations. Beds were comfortable and rooms were clean. We had lunch and a few breakfasts in their dining room. The food was good, especially the cheese blintzes at the breakfast buffet. A few finger foods were put out in the lounge each weekday afternoon. Some used the pool and the nice patio tables. Others used the business center.  The location was convenient. It's directly across from the airport, which can oftentimes be a drawback (noisey), but John Wayne airport does not have flights past 10:00 or 10:30 pm, so it's not as if you're hearing them all night long. Because of its proximity to the airport, it's also very close and convenient to
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has undergone a recent renovation of their rooms.  The decor was tasteful, furniture looked brand new, bathrooms had granite counter tops, and the pillow top beds/linens were really comfortable.  The hotel itself was very old though. The hallways were dark and my room had popcorn ceilings. I couldn't hear neighbors talking through the walls but every night and every morning I could hear toilets flushing from all the rooms around me....very strange.  Also, if your in the room during the day and facing the airport/runway side, the noise of the jets landing is fairly loud.  The in-unit air-conditioning system was also very loud.  If you're sensitive to noise I would recommend staying in a newer hotel in the area, further away from the airport.

Summary: Very convinent property that is in a great central location to everything we needed in Orange County. All of the rooms were newly renovated and the beds were great.

Summary: The renovation was well done.  I found a comfy bed, a clean, spacious room and bathroom, and pleasant public areas.  The elevators are the only sign of age remaining at this property.  Great breakfast buffet, too.  Like others, I'm put-off by the high parking fees, but it seems everything in the area is very high.  The location is one-half block from the airport entrance, though the positioning of the hotel (and noise restrictions) prevent airplane noise annoyance.

Summary: basic hilton.  You have to pay to park, a fact that I'm not crazy about, but most hotels in that area charge.  Nice bed.

Summary: Stayed two nights on a buisness trip.  The mattress and bedding were so cushy and comfortable!  Room was very clean and furnished nicely.

Summary Heading: Pretty good, looking forward to the renovations....
Summary: First time in this hotel.  I travel to Orange 3 times monthly.  Usually I stay at the Embassy Suites on Main Street (average as well), but this time the ES was booked.  I was in room 821 for my one night stay.  The staff was very friendly at both the front desk and at breakfast the next day.  Pay for parking ???  Why??  I already paid $209/night which is >$70 more than the Embassy Suites 1 mile away, and adding ~$9 on top of that to park my rental car is not right.  I did not use the internet access nor room service so I cannot comment on those.  The hotel staff pasted "please excuse our dust" signs all over speaking to their up coming renovations this month.  I must say, the hotel looks dated, but the room was clean, the TV worked fine and the view from the accesible balconey

Summary: I stayed in the Hilton for the start of my 3 week holiday in the US. Being part of a group rate booking helped out, paying $84 per night I thought was ok.  Being across from John Wayne airport was a concern, but did not find this too much of a noise problem. I was kept awake more by the air conditioning fans from the restaurant.  The bed was very clean, comfortable, with good service from the staff.  Would recommend it if you can get a bit of discount.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Hilton in August.  The hotel is old with very nice beds.  However, I received a rate of $55 on Hotwire and for the money, this is a great hotel.    The hotel needs updating.  The lobby looks old, the hallways are old, etc.  The best thing about the hotel is the new beds, they are wonderful.  So all in all, if you get a good rate- the hotel is fine.  But do not pay over $100 as there are probably better choices.

Summary: I recently attended a convention at the Hilton in Irvine at John Wayne Airport.  Pro--1.  The bed was WONDERFUL --cushy, upgraded linens, terrific pillows.  Other guests also made positive comments on the beds! 2.  Had breakfast, lunch, and dinner with my large convention group on different days.  All were excellent.  Some servers inexperienced, but attempted to please.  3.  All public areas and rooms well-maintained.  4. Convenient location.  Easy to get on/off freeway. Neutral--1.  Across the street from the JW airport, so was a little noisy, but not a major problem.  2.  Check in desk personnel need more training in greeting guests and customer service.  Act like you enjoy your job.  Don't let trainees deal with guests until they know what they're doing.  It makes a bad

Summary: After reading the reviews about airplane noise I was hesitant about staying here, since Priceline doesn't give you a choice. However, I had no reason to worry, Orange County is very concerned with noise pollution and no planes take off or land at John Wayne between the hours of 10pm and 7am. Very reasonable...I only heard a plane once or twice when we were outside the hotel. I'm not sure what the other reviews were referring to.  I got my rate on Priceline and paid $60/nite, next time I'd try for a lower price b/c I'm sure you'd get it. The bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. The color scheme of the room did seem slightly dated but certainly not worn or disgusting. The bathroom was clean and a good size. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. There is valet or self

Summary Heading: There's got to be better places to stay in the area...
Summary: This hotel wasn't bad.  Typical Hilton as far as services go.  The room was nice.  If given the choice, I think I would rather stay at a Hampton Inn if there is one in the area.  There is very little in close proximity to this hotel.  My wife and I drove the whole street and found very little in the way of places to eat and things to do.  One big problem:  It is literally right across the street from the Orange County Airport runway.  Nothing like falling asleep to the roar of jet engines at night!  To be fair, you can drown them out with the tv and the AC.

Summary: Stayed here 1 night.  The room was great.  It looked as though it had recently been renovated.  The beds were VERY comfortable and room spacious.  I made my reservation through an online bid for travel company and paid only $35 plus tax and fees.  Awesome deal.  They do charge $8.00 a night for parking.  It is located right across from the airport, but airplane noise is no problem.  Lobby beautiful, staff friendly, all in all a excellent experience.
